com.example.as1

Class BrawlerFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.as1.BrawlerFrame
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ActiveBrawlerFrame, FightBrawlerFrame, ShopBrawlerFrame

    public class BrawlerFrame
extends java.lang.Object
    The BrawlerFrame class is a helper class for rendering and managing brawler images and their associated stats in a mobile game app.
    Author:
    Drew Kinneer, Jack Kelley

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Activity activity 
      protected TextView attack 
      protected Brawler brawler 
      protected ImageView brawlerImage 
      protected Dialog dialog 
      protected TextView health 
      protected int index 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      The "clear" function sets the brawler to null, removes the brawler image, and removes the attack and health views from the parent layout.
      Brawler getBrawler()
      The function returns a Brawler object.
      ImageView getBrawlerImage()
      The function returns an ImageView object representing a brawler image.
      int getIndex()
      The function returns the value of the variable "index".
      protected void renderStats()
      This function renders the attack and health stats of a brawler in a ConstraintLayout.
      void setBrawler(Brawler brawler)
      The function sets the value of a Brawler object to a class variable.
      void setBrawlerImage(ImageView brawlerImage)
      This function sets the image of a brawler in a Java program.
      void setBrawlerImageByUrl(java.lang.String imageUrl)
      The function sets a brawler image by URL using an image loader and checks if the image is cached before making a network call.
      void setIndex(int index)
      This function sets the value of the "index" variable to the input parameter "index".

      • setBrawlerImageByUrl

        public void setBrawlerImageByUrl(java.lang.String imageUrl)
        The function sets a brawler image by URL using an image loader and checks if the image is cached before making a network call.
        Parameters:
        imageUrl - The URL of the image that needs to be loaded and displayed.
